text: Guyana competed at the 2019 Pan American Games in Lima, Peru from July 26 to August 11, 2019. On July 14, 2019 the Guyana Olympic Association announced the full team of 26 athletes (17 men and nine women) competing in eight sports. During the opening ceremony of the games, boxer Keevin Allicock carried the flag of the country as part of the parade of nations. ==Competitors== The following is the list of number of competitors (per gender) participating at the games per sport/discipline. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align:center;" |- ! width=140|Sport ! width=55|Men ! width=55|Women ! width=55|Total |- | align=left|Athletics (track and field) | 1||3||4 |- | align=left|Boxing | 1 ||0||1 |- | align=left|Badminton | 1 ||1 ||2 |- | align=left|Rugby sevens | 12 ||0 ||12 |- | align=left|Squash | 0 ||3 ||3 |- | align=left|Swimming | 1 ||1 ||2 |- | align=left|Table tennis | 0 ||1||1 |- | align=left|Taekwondo | 1 ||0||1 |- !
